update.description:
Main changes here are:

  - Deprecate ode specifics in `PhysicsEngine.hh`, replace with a more general `SetParam`.
  - Update bullet/dart/ode/simbody implementations of SetParam.  Breakage in API includes:
       - changes of `void SetParam` to `bool SetParam`, returns false on failure to set parameter.
       - update implementation of simobdy header for upcoming integrator changes.
update.title: isolate changes from pull request #999, only updating physics headers without introducing new features.

content.raw: Don't include the deprecated function in the new function's comment. It will be very difficult to remove it after the deprecated function is removed. Instead, use the `\sa` doxygen comment int the deprecated function's comments.
content.html: Don't include the deprecated function in the new function's comment. It will be very difficult to remove it after the deprecated function is removed. Instead, use the \sa doxygen comment int the deprecated function's comments.

pullrequest.title: isolate changes from pull request #999, only updating physics headers without introducing new features.

content.raw: you are right about that.  It's currently configured incorrectly.  ODE returns "quick", Bullet returns "sequential_impulse", dart does not support keyword "type" and simbody returns "simbody".  I'll modifying the code to return solver types used by physics engine, e.g. "sequential_impulse|quick" for keyword "solver_type", and deprecate support for vague keyword "type".
content.html: you are right about that. It's currently configured incorrectly. ODE returns "quick", Bullet returns "sequential_impulse", dart does not support keyword "type" and simbody returns "simbody". I'll modifying the code to return solver types used by physics engine, e.g. "sequential_impulse|quick" for keyword "solver_type", and deprecate support for vague keyword "type".
